title: How can ONE deck of cards bring this much enjoyment?!
text: This game is EVERYTHING. If you love the cutthroat competition of monopoly, but not the drawn-out games, get ready to LOVE this card deck. A round only takes around 15 minutes, so people can take turns winning and not hold lifelong grudges like a grueling multi-hour game of traditional monopoly. While it takes a few plays to develop strategy, the basics are easy to grasp. One of my favorite things about the deck is that it comes with concise, easy-read instruction cards for each player to refer to throughout the game.

title: ALL TIME FAVORITE 2-PLAYER GAME
text: There's so many things to love about this product. Firstly, I searched far and wide (Target, Walmart, Big Lots, etc), and they no longer sell this version in-store so purchasing on Amazon with 2-day shipping was a big win. This game is one of the easiest to learn which means a lot coming from an impatient person. It's also very hard to find 2-player games, but this one works great for my boyfriend and I to play together. It is most ideal for 2-3 people, 4-5 is pushing it a bit just due to the size of the deck. I would recommend buying 2 decks if you regularly plan with a group of 5+. Each "round" is only 15-20 mins making for a low time commitment as well, and this game is probably 60% luck and 40% strategy. It has a similar concept to the actual Monopoly board game but is just easier, faster, and simpler. Highly recommend!

title: More economically realistic than the board game
text: More realistic than the board game.  In this version (like real life), some people start the game with an incredible advantage via dumb luck.  Although some people are able to overcome the disadvantage of being dealt a bad initial hand, many succeed based upon the luck of the draw and may even misinterpret it as skill.  The board game starts everyone out at the same place with the same amount of money, which is a bit unbelievable for a game that‚Äôs supposed to reflect economic activity.

title: Causing families to fall apart...now in travel size!
text:
I bought this for a family trip to play when we had downtime because our family loves monopoly (even though it always ends in competitive chaos). Of course, when it came in we had to test it out before going on the road. It looked so complicated at first but the end of the instructions are right, you will learn it more as you play. It took one game to get the hang of it, which lasted about 20 minutes or so. Then 6 or 7 more games to prove dominance over all of them. Now, we are ready to take to the road and see what chaos ensues along the way!
Hope this helps
P.S. I'd say it plays similar to gin rummy in a sense.

title: Although best enjoyed in groups
text:
One of the most addictive, competitive, easy-to-learn party games I've encountered. Although best enjoyed in groups, I even really enjoyed playing this "2-player mode," with just myself and my sister.

The initial concept can be complicated, but really it's just... "collect all properties of a color to get a 'set'," which follows traditional monopoly. get 3 sets, and you win. The other intricacies are what sound complicated, like: moves allowed. when you can play moves. when to put down property cards. all that. but you'll find that there's real strategy in this game, and just like in the traditional, true Monopoly fashion,

This game has the potential to break friendships and relationships. hahahha okay maybe not quite that severe. but definitely rises up anyone's competitive edge.

title: A quick fun card game that anyone can enjoy!
text:
Love the game! Overall a quick fun game (15-20min) that kids and adults can enjoy!
On your turn you get up to 3 actions. Bank money, play a property or play an action card. To win the game you need 3 unique sets of property played in front of you. For example, all 3 greens, all 2 blues, all 3 yellows = WIN.

There are many aspects of monopoly in the game like renting others with your property or building hotels to get more rent. Like the original, rent an opponent enough and your opponents need to pay with their own property! Action cards have various fun powers like charging money, forcing a property trade, stealing a property, etc, great for any player that starts leading too much or for you to grab the win!

title: Monopoly Deal Is Monopoly Deal
text:
Let me be clear--I hate Monopoly. On the other hand, I LOVE Monopoly Deal! This is actually the second time I've bought this game here on Amazon. We played it so much that the cards started to fall apart. Don't worry, it took about 2 years of constant use for that to happen. This game is one of the few that is still fun with just two players, but it's even more fun with more players. It's just a deck of cards which makes it compact for travel, and they've created two cards with very succinct and clear instructions.

This is one of my favorite games of all time, and I'll be a long-time buyer when this new set wears out again.

title: Nothing at all like the board game, and much better for it.
text: For years I ignored this game because I thought, if the board game is so dull, how could the card game be any better? It wasn't until I moved to Vietnam that I discovered this gem, oddly enough. I noticed foreigners playing it rather frequently, and found that a game company here had re-designed the card game to mimic the style of 1800's Hanoi or Saigon, depending on the version purchased. Not only did this game turn out to be really addictive, but whoever designed these versions put a lot of love and time into the myriad of little details that make these cards gorgeous to look at as well. I know this review is for the U.S. version, which is frankly just depressing to look at. When I went back to the States (after giving everyone in my family a set of their own Hanoi Monopoly Deal) I picked up the U.S. version and was shocked at how plain it looks. If you can put that aside, this is a great game, and is so addictive because no two matches are alike. But really, it feels like I'm talking about a live unicorn I've got a in my backyard that no one can see unless they come to Vietnam and get these highly superior, beautifully designed cards.

title: We love this game
text:
We love this game. It is as short as monopoly (the board game) is long. Okay, maybe not that short, but you get the idea. We bought a bunch of the game so that when random people stopped by for Christmas we would have something to give to them.

Game play is strategic but you can never be sure you have what you think you have because someone might charge you rent or make you pay because "it's their birthday!" or (even better/worse) steal your properties or completed sets right from you. However, there are cards to combat this and it is fun to watch how it all shakes out. Last time we played, it clearly looked like one person was going to win and then by the end of the game they had nearly nothing.

While the game itself is fantastic, the game quality is lacking. The cards are much thinner than normal playing cards and the boxes (we got something like four of them) looked pretty shabby, even though they were well packaged. Also, the top is closed with a sticker (which is standard), but just getting that off tore the box on all of the ones I opened. Also, the cards are shrink wrapped and in opening them, be careful because it is easy to damage the thin cards.

In conclusion, fun game but not the greatest quality.

title: Finally, a game of Monopoly that doesn't take 3 years to complete.
text:
Do you get a headache every time someone mentions the game Monopoly? It's such a tedious, drawn-out, brutal game to play with friends. Every time someone mentions it I think of long hours sitting around the table, endlessly running around the board paying rent, earning scraps and eventually going bankrupt.

No more of that! Monopoly Deal only takes the concepts from the board game and condenses it into a FUN 20 minute game with friends. The point of the game is to collect 3 full sets of properties. There are cards that let you collect money, steal properties, force trades and cancel actions. Once you get the hang of it (and its very easy to learn), play moves at a pretty quick pace. Place money down to protect your properties, if you don't have money cards and someone's collecting rent, you'll have to pay them with your precious properties.

If you like the original game and other versions and the ‚Äúdrama‚Äù that comes with them, then you may be disappointed with this quick version. I don‚Äôt mind the quickness of it, but when the 3rd set is complete, it‚Äôs pretty anti-climactic. No satisfaction on either the winning or losing side. It‚Äôs a game with a ton of foreplay and no climax.

title: So much better than actual Monopoly!
text:
I've had game night at my house dozens of times and we play a wide array of games and out of all the games, this is the most popular one. Not a single person dislikes it! Like the box suggests, games take around 15 minutes to play. It's simple enough for people who aren't too game savvy and has enough strategic element to keep the veteran gamer entertained.

Over time, we have altered the game slightly and now play with 2 decks taking out some of the less powerful cards to make it even more insane. I'd recommend this game to literally anyone and after just a few games, I guarantee you'll be addicted to it!

title: all the best parts of Monopoly, without the worst
text: Take out the worst parts of Monopoly (it takes too long, once someone gets ahead it's a slow death to all other players) and you've got Monopoly deal. A great, fun, easy to learn game. Have already bought it for multiple people as gifts!

title: Loved by the entire family
text: This game is a total hit. It allows for a quick one hand play before bedtime or hours of entertainment.  This game is enjoyed by my 8 year-old to my 15 year-old and through my 78 year-old dad.  You win some hands, you lose some hands, but it seems you always have a chance at winning. The rules are quite simple and are mastered after a couple of hands. Easy setup and put away, no scoring necessary and all done with some new twists while retaining old familiar properties. This will definitely be a classic in our home as it has already led to many fun times and great memories. I would have no reservation purchasing a new deck or replacement deck of Monopoly Deal.

title: Fun and easy game to learn!

title: May have saved my marriage
text: I actually got this game a couple years ago at a Christmas white elephant party, but felt obligated to leave a review now anyways.  The host of the party actually thought it was hilarious that I ended up with this game because the last time her and her now husband played real monopoly with me and my now wife, my wife flipped the board breaking a couple wine glasses and I left to go to the neighborhood bar with a buddy. On top of that, my wife and I were hesitant to learn a new game so this sat in the cabinet for two years (we shouldn‚Äôt have been, super easy to learn). Fast forward those two years and we are in the middle of this sh*tshow called 2020, quarantined with no one to talk to but each other. To break up the boredom we decided to give the now dust covered game a chance.  It is all we have done during the quarantine (other than drink too much).  Every night we have played several hands.  We only got into a fight once after I ruthlessly beat her two games in a row by nonstop rent, birthday, and debt collector cards thus stealing all of her property and quickly winning in dominating fashion. (She has learned to build a cash reserve since.)  Imagine how many fights we would have got in with real monopoly! Or any other card game? This game very potentially saved my marriage.

The rules seemed a little confusing but once we began play the 1st and 3rd graders had it down pat.  (They had to keep reminding me of the details).  If you like games, you'll love this one.  Buy it.  I bought one for our home and one for each adult child's family.

text: We love this game! My 6-year-old is addicted to Monopoly but it is such a long game. This is short and we can play it on the couch while relaxing after dinner :) I‚Äôm honestly not much of a game person, but I genuinely look forward to playing it with the kids. Highly recommend.

title: Sadistic Fun
text: If you enjoy the passive-aggressive fun of the Monopoly board game, get a quicker fix with the Monopoly card game. Wreak havoc on your family or close friends‚Äô emotions. Devastate your smug grandmother‚Äôs plans and bring that haughty old bag back down to earth. Overall rating: supa dupa!

title: Great game for adults
text:
My husband and I travel with another couple and we try to take a game or two along with us to play when wanting to relax during some "down time". We have played 5 Crowns as an example and were looking for addition games that are small in size (need to fit in carry-on only luggage) and yet fun. This was recommended by another friend of ours and she was right!

It's just the perfect level of complexity for us. You have to pay attention and yet don't have to concentrate so much as to no longer be fun. We also wanted something that two or three of us could play if not every one was in the mood. We tried it out a couple of weeks ago here at home and it was a big hit! I've also played it with my adult daughter and she enjoyed it as well.

Great purchase and a lot of fun!

title: Fast-Paced Fun for All
text: I love this game because it is affordable and fast-paced. The game maintains the essence of Monopoly while condensing it into a fast-paced card game, making it perfect for those seeking a fun and competitive experience without lengthy playtime. Its compact size and quick setup make it an ideal travel companion for gaming.
